instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3115: What is 820-3115? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.PPVBAT_G3H_CONN: What is PPVBAT_G3H_CONN? This is the where the batteryâ€™s power rail connects to the motherboard. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - B - Battery + Wireles (Weird)
threads.message:
When I connect the battery, the laptop restarts.
When I connect the wireless cable, the computer does not respond.

computer itself is fine, but when i plug, don't work

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - B - Battery + Wireles (Weird)
threads.message:
Are the battery and wifi cable/airport card tested? Very likely liquid damage to airport card or the cable. 
Does the battery indicator light up if you press the button without the battery installed?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - B - Battery + Wireles (Weird)
threads.message:
The battery Indicator light works.
I will test the airport card.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - B - Battery + Wireles (Weird)
threads.message: Is it charging the battery at all? Or is the machine not working at all when the battery is connected?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - B - Battery + Wireles (Weird)
threads.message: the machine dont working at all when the battery is connected

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - B - Battery + Wireles (Weird)
threads.message: I would try a known good battery first then.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - B - Battery + Wireles (Weird)
threads.message: I try before and don't work.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - B - Battery + Wireles (Weird)
threads.message: What is your <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> voltage with only AC. Then check it with machine off and only battery connected. Measure at F7040

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - B - Battery + Wireles (Weird)
threads.message: <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> in F7040 is 12.57V

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - B - Battery + Wireles (Weird)
threads.message: And how much with a battery plugged in? There could be a short on <SIGNAL>PPVBAT_G3H_CONN</SIGNAL>

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - B - Battery + Wireles (Weird)
threads.message: <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> in F7040 just battery: 11.47v

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - B - Battery + Wireles (Weird)
threads.message: <SIGNAL>PPVBAT_G3H_CONN</SIGNAL> (just battery): 11.04v

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - B - Battery + Wireles (Weird)
threads.message: Any Advice, Louis?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - B - Battery + Wireles (Weird)
threads.message:
Where was the original damage? Drop, liquid somewhere(where if liquid)? This is too weird a problem to just happen out of the blue. We need hints!

The last time I had a machine that would reboot when charger or battery was plugged in it was an SMC issue, but that was almost three years ago... and once, ever.

When you plug in a known good battery with a full charge, do you get all the green LEDs to light up on the battery indicator?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - B - Battery + Wireles (Weird)
threads.message:
Battery issue Fixed!

I'm working right now on the AIRPORT/BLUETOOTH. When i plug in the board, the computer wont turn on, or will turn on and shutdown.

Any advice guys?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - B - Battery + Wireles (Weird)
threads.message: Louis or Duck, any advice?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - B - Battery + Wireles (Weird)
threads.message: Did you replace the airport and cable? What was the battery issue?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - B - Battery + Wireles (Weird)
threads.message: Yes, i replaced the airport. Keeping rebooting...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - B - Battery + Wireles (Weird)
threads.message: You replaced the airport, did you replace the cable? Are you connecting this with the machine on?? I hope not!

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - B - Battery + Wireles (Weird)
threads.message: No Title

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - B - Battery + Wireles (Weird)
threads.message: I just replace the <TRANSISTOR>Q7085</TRANSISTOR> and everything works fine.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - B - Battery + Wireles (Weird)
threads.message: no i didn't.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - B - Battery + Wireles (Weird)
threads.message:
I see a picture but you still did not say if the cable was replaced.
I also see some crap around <TRANSISTOR>Q7812</TRANSISTOR>, what is going on there?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - B - Battery + Wireles (Weird)
threads.message: The <TRANSISTOR>Q7812</TRANSISTOR> is fine also i replaced the cable.
